intro: Gomphrena moquinii, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, feathery inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in compact, spherical heads. Gomphrena moquinii is often used in ornamental gardening for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
